intro: Ichnocarpus wariana, commonly known as the Indian hibiscus or velvet bean, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia and parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with five petals. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain flat, kidney-shaped seeds covered in a sticky, resinous coating. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in medicine and as a source of protein-rich seeds. The botanical features of Ichnocarpus wariana make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
